page.title: 04WORTHEN FIRE STATION
page.content: There has been a fire engine and fire station in Worthen for about fifty years.Today there are ten {retained {fire men.}They have to be eighteen to join and they train for two hours once a week. Retained fire men work at other jobs but come to the fire engine when they are needed,they carry bleepers around with them.The engine needs at least six people to a fire.Mr Les Taylor has been{Leading fireman} until he retired this year (1985).He has been at the fire station for 32 years and was awarded the {British {Empire Medal.}The fire men go out fifty to sixty times a year.The farthest distance to a fire is about fifty miles.The fire engine holds 400 gallons of water. The firestation building is an old stone building next to a former inn.
